contextId.information: "do not ignore what they did" This can be stated in positive form. AT: "judge them because of what they did" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])

These phrases mean essentially the same thing. The first is stated in negative form, and the second is stated in positive form. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
